description: Erection of rear dormer roof extension to facilitate loft conversion

constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT

decision_conditions: The submitted drawings are inconsistent and inaccurate such that Officers cannot conclude that the extension is compliant with B.1(b). On the balance of probability, it is considered that the rearmost dormer extension would in fact exceed the highest point of the existing roof, contrary to B.1(b) of Class B of Part 1, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

The submitted drawings are inconsistent and do not accurately show the development as built. Noting that the drawings appear to have underrated the width and height of what has been built, Officers consider that, on the balance of probability, the extension exceeds 50m3, contrary to B1.(d) (ii) of Class B of Part 1, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).
The development includes a balcony, contrary to B.1(e) of Class B of Part 1, Schedule 2 of theTown and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

The materials used in the exterior work of the extension are not of a similar appearance to those used in the construction of the exterior of the existing dwellinghouse and accentuate the visual impact of the extension and is not sympathetic to the existing house, contrary to Condition B.2(a) of Class B of Part 1, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

The development does not join the original roof to the roof of the rear outrigger and the extension extends beyond the outside face of the external walls of the original outrigger and the eaves have not been maintained or reinstated, contrary to Conditions B2.(b)(i)(aa),(bb) and (ii) of Class B of Part 1, Schedule 2 of theTown and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).
